actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title XVI of the Social Security Act to provide that parents' income and resources shall not be attributed to a child under age 21 for purposes of determining such child's eligibility for SSI benefits, if such child is under a disability which is permanent and total.

summary.text: Amends title XVI (Supplemental Security Income) of the Social Security Act to provide that parents' income and resources shall not be attributed to a child under age 21 for purposes of determining such child's eligibility for supplemental security income benefits, if such child is under a disability which is permanent and total.

titles.title: A bill to amend title XVI of the Social Security Act to provide that parents' income and resources shall not be attributed to a child under age 21 for purposes of determining such child's eligibility for SSI benefits, if such child is under a disability which is permanent and total.
